column4: Can someone help me out with this problem I'm having after an upgrade of my entire system. - http://pastebin.com/YiBbY6Ar
the entry for / in your /etc/fstab is using the wrong UUID i believe - you could either correct the UUID or use the old /dev/sdX# method
my /etc/fstab does not show any UIDs....
are you looking at the right one?  your error certainly states a missing/incorrect UUID.  somethings strange man.  good luck - gotta run.
